Question: P and Q are two points on the ground on either side of a pole. The angles of elevation of the top of the pole as observed from P and Q are 60° and 30°, respectively and the distance between them is 84√3 m. What is the height (in m) of the pole?
Solution:
Let the height of the tower be AB
Given, PQ = 84√3
In ΔABQ
tan30 = AB/QB
⇒ 1/√3 = AB/QB
⇒ AB = QB/√3 ----(1)
In ΔABP
tan60 = AB/PB
⇒ √3 = AB/PB
⇒ AB = √3PB ----(2)
From equation (1) and equation (2)
⇒ √3 PB = QB/√3
⇒ QB = 3PB
As we know,
⇒ PQ = PB + BQ
⇒ PQ = PB + 3PB
⇒ 84√3 = 4PB
⇒ PB = 84√3/4
⇒ PB = 21√3
From equation (2)
⇒ AB = √3 PB
⇒ AB = √3 × 21√3
⇒ AB = 63 m
Short trick:

From the following figure
⇒ 4 unit = 84√3
⇒ 1 unit = 21√3
⇒ √3 unit = 21√3 × √3 = 63 m

Solution:
As we know,
Unit digit of 361284
⇒ 34

So we can say if we divide 361284 by 5 then we get remainder 1.
x = 1
As we know,
4 ÷ 6, then remainder 4

4n ÷ 6, then remainder 4
Where n = natural number.
So we can say 496 is divided by 6, then the remainder is 4.
y = 4
Now, (2x – y)

Question: The value of \(\frac{{\left( {\sin \theta - cos\theta } \right)\left( {1\; + \;\tan \theta \; + \;cot\theta } \right)}}{{1\; + \;sin\theta cos\theta }}\)
Solution:
Short Trick :
\(\frac{{\left( {\sin \theta - cos\theta } \right)\left( {1\; + \;\tan \theta \; + \;cot\theta } \right)}}{{1\; + \;sin\theta cos\theta }}\)
Put θ = 30
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{\left( {\sin 30 - cos30} \right)\left( {1\; + \;\tan 30\; + \;cot30} \right)}}{{1\; + \;sin30\;cos30}}\)
\(\Rightarrow \;\frac{{\left( {\frac{1}{2} - \frac{{\sqrt 3 }}{2}} \right)\left( {1\; + \;\frac{1}{{\sqrt 3 }}\; + \;\sqrt 3 } \right)}}{{1\; + \;\frac{1}{2} \times \frac{{\sqrt 3 }}{2}}}\; = \;\frac{{\left( {\frac{{1 - \sqrt 3 }}{2}} \right)\left( {\frac{{1\; + \;\sqrt 3 \; + \;3}}{{\sqrt 3 }}} \right)}}{{\frac{{4\; + \;\sqrt 3 }}{4}}}\; = \;\frac{{\left( {\frac{{1 - \sqrt 3 }}{2}} \right)\left( {\frac{{4\; + \;\sqrt 3 }}{{\sqrt 3 }}} \right)}}{{\frac{{4\; + \;\sqrt 3 }}{4}}}\)
⇒ [2(1 - √3)]/√3
From the first option
⇒ sec θ – cosec θ
⇒ sec 30 – cosec 30
⇒ 2/√3 – 2
⇒ [2(1 - √3)]/√3
Detailed Solution :
\(\Rightarrow {\rm{\;}}\frac{{\left( {\sin \theta - cos\theta } \right)\left( {1\; + \;\tan \theta \; + \;cot\theta } \right)}}{{1\; + \;sin\theta cos\theta }}\)
⇒ \(\frac{{\left( {\sin \theta - cos\theta } \right)\left( {1\; + \;\frac{{sin\theta }}{{cos\theta }}\; + \;\frac{{cos\theta }}{{sin\theta }}} \right)}}{{1\; + \;sin\theta cos\theta }}\)
\(\Rightarrow {\rm{\;}}\frac{{\frac{{\left( {\sin \theta - cos\theta } \right)\left( {cos\theta \;sin\theta \; + \;si{n^2}\theta \; + \;co{s^2}\theta } \right)}}{{sin\theta cos\theta }}}}{{1\; + \;sin\theta cos\theta }}\)
\(\Rightarrow {\rm{\;}}\frac{{\frac{{\left( {\sin \theta - cos\theta } \right)\left( {cos\theta \;sin\theta \; + \;1} \right)}}{{sin\theta cos\theta }}}}{{1\; + \;sin\theta cos\theta }}\)
⇒ (sin θ – cos θ)/(sinθ cosθ)
⇒ 1/cosθ – 1/sinθ
⇒ sec θ – cosec θ

Question: Walking at 60% of his usual speed, a man reaches his destination 1 hour 40 minutes late. His usual time (in hours) to reach the destination is:
Solution:
60% = 3/5
Let the speed of the man be 5x
60% of the speed = 5x × (3/5) = 3x
Ratio of speed of man before and after = 5x : 3x
As we know, Speed is inversely proportional to time.
Time ratio of man before and after = 3x : 5x
According to the question
5x – 3x = 1 hr 40 min = (1 + 40/60) hr
⇒ 2x = 5/3
⇒ x = 5/(3 × 2) = 5/6 hr
Required time = 3x = 3 × (5/6) = \(2\frac{1}{2}\)

Question: The value of sin<sup>2</sup> 64° + cos 64° sin 26° + 2 cos 43° cosec 47° is:
Solution:
sin2 64° + cos 64° sin 26° + 2 cos 43° cosec 47°
⇒ sin2 64° + cos 64° sin (90° - 64°) + 2 cos 43° cosec (90° – 43°)
⇒ sin2 64° + cos 64° cos 64° + 2 cos 43° sec 43°
⇒ sin2 64° + cos2 64° + 2 cos 43° (1/cos 43°)
⇒ 1 + 2
⇒ 3Additional Information

Question: The value of (1 + cot θ – cosec θ) (1 + cos θ + sin θ) sec θ = ?
Solution:
(1 + cot θ – cosec θ) (1 + cos θ + sin θ) sec θ
⇒ (1 + cos θ/sin θ – 1/sin θ) (1 + cos θ + sin θ) sec θ
⇒ [(sin θ + cos θ – 1)/sin θ] (1 + cos θ + sin θ) sec θ
⇒ [(sin θ + cos θ)2 – 12] sec θ cosec θ
⇒ [sin2 θ + cos2 θ + 2 sin θ cos θ – 1] sec θ cosec θ
⇒ [1 + 2 sin θ cos θ – 1] sec θ cosec θ
⇒ (2 sin θ cos θ) sec θ cosec θ
⇒ [2/cosec θ sec θ] sec θ cosec θ
⇒ 2

Question: Two parallel chords on the same side of the centre of a circle are 12 cm and 20 cm long and the radius of the circle is 5√13 cm. What is the distance (in cm) between the chords?
Solution:
OB = OD = 5 √13 cm
AB = 12 cm, CD = 20 cm, AM = MB = 12/2 = 6 cm and CN = ND = 20/2 = 10 cm
In Δ MBO
OB2 = MB2 + MO2
⇒ (5 √13)2 = 62 + OM2
⇒ OM2 = 325 – 36 = 289
⇒ OM = √289 = 17
In Δ NDO
OD2 = ND2 + NO2
⇒ (5 √13)2 = 102 + NO2
⇒ ON2 = 325 – 100 = 225
ON = √225 = 15
As we know,
OM = MN + ON
⇒ 17 = MN + 15
⇒ MN = 17 – 15 = 2 cm

Question: The internal diameter of a hollow hemispherical vessel is 24 cm. It is made of a steel sheet which is 0.5 cm thick. What is the total surface area (in cm<sup>2</sup>) of the vessel?
Solution:
Internal radius of hollow hemispherical vessel = 24/2 = 12 cm
Thick of vessel (t) = 0.5 cm
External radius of hollow hemispherical vessel = 12 + 0.5 = 12.5 cm
As we know,
Total surface area of hollow hemispherical vessel = π [(R2 - r2) + 2 (R2 + r2)]
[(12.52 – 122) + 2 × (12.52 + 122)] π
⇒ [(156.25 – 144) + 2 (156.25 + 144)] π
⇒ [12.25 + 2 × 300.25] π
⇒ [12.25 + 600.5] π
⇒ 612.75 π

Question: A can do one - third of a work in 15 days, B can do 75% of the same work in 18 days and C can do the same work in 36 days. B and C work together for 8 days. In how many days will A alone complete the remaining work?
Solution:
A can do 1/3rd of work in = 15 days
A can do the whole work in = 15 × 3 = 45 days
B can do 75% of the work in = 18 days
B can do the whole work in = 18 × (100/75) = 24 days
C can do the whole work in = 36 days
Total work = 360
∴ The efficiency of A, B and C is 8, 15 and 10 respectively.
Work done by B and C in 8 days = (15 + 10) × 8 = 200
∴ Remaining work A will complete in = (360 – 200)/8 = 160/8 = 20 days

Question: The price of oil is increased by 20%. However, its consumption decreased by \(8\frac{1}{3}\%\). What is the percentage increase or decrease in the expenditure on it?
Solution:
Let the price of the oil be Rs. x and consumption be y.
So old expenditure= xy
So the new price= x+ 20 % x= 1.2 x
New consumption= y- \(8\frac{1}{3}\%\)y= y- (y/12)= 11y/12
New expenditure= 1.2x × 11y/12 = 1.1 xy
Percentage of expenditure increased by = [(1.1xy – xy)/xy] × 100 = 10%.
Alternate MethodConcept used:
Price × consumption = Expenditure
Calculation: The price of oil is increased by 20% = 1/5 Consumption decreased by \(8\frac{1}{3}\%\) = 25/3% = 1/12
OldNew
Price56
Consumption1211
Expenditure60 (5 ×12)66 (6 × 11)
The final value of expenditure in ratio.1011
So, the final Expenditure in ratio = 10 : 11 Percentage increase = (New - old) /old × 100 ⇒ Percentage increase = (11 - 10) / 10 × 100 = 10% ∴ The percentage increase in the expenditure is 10%.

Question: In a ΔABC. D is point on BC. AB is produce to E and AC is produce to F. A circle is passes through DEF, where AB = 10 cm, AC = 8.6 cm and BC = 6.4, then BE = ?
Solution:
Concept:
From the same external point, the tangent segments to a circle
are equal.
Calculation:

Given, AB = 10 cm, AC = 8.6 cm and BC = 6.4 cm
Let BE = x cm and CF = y cm
As we know,
BE = BD [tangents]
DC = CF [tangents]
AE = AF [tangents]
AB + BE = AC + CF
⇒ 10 + x = 8.6 + y
⇒ x – y = 8.6 – 10
⇒ x – y = - 1.4 ----(1)
BD + DC = 6.4
⇒ x + y = 6.4 ----(2)
From equation (1) and equation (2)
⇒ x = 2.5
∴ BE = 2.5 cm

Question: In ΔABD, C is the midpoint of BD. If AB = 10 cm, AD = 12 cm and AC = 9 cm, then BD = ?
Solution:
As we know,
AB2 + AD2 = 2(BC2 + AC2)
⇒ 102 + 122 = 2 (BC2 + 92)
⇒ 100 + 144 = 2 (BC2 + 81)
⇒ 244/2 = (BC2 + 81)
⇒ BC2 = 122 – 81
⇒ BC2 = 41
⇒ BC = √41
⇒ BD = 2 × BC ⇒ 2 × √41

Question: The average age of 120 students in a group is 13.56 years. 35% of the number of students are girls and the rest are boys. If the ratio of the average age of boys and girls is 6 : 5, then what is the average age (in years) of the girls?
Solution:
Sum of age of 120 students in a group whose age is 13.56 = 120 × 13.56 = 1627.2
Number of girls in the group = 120 × (35/100) = 42
Number of boys in the group = 120 – 42 = 78
Let the average of boys and girls are 6x and 5x respectively.
According to the question
78 × 6x + 42 × 5x = 1627.2
⇒ 468x + 210x = 1627.2
⇒ 678x = 1627.2
⇒ x = 1627.2/678
⇒ x = 2.4
Average age of girls = 5x = 5 × 2.4 = 12
Shortcut Tric Let the average age of class X.
By alligation:-

So
\(\frac{6-X}{X-5}\)= \(\frac{7}{13}\)
X = 5.65
The average of the class is 13.56 years
5.65 → 13.56 years
1 → 2.4 years
The average age of girls = 5 × 2.4 = 12 years

Question: If in ΔABC, D and E are the points on AB and BC respectively such that DE∥AC, and AD : AB = 3 : 8, then (area of ΔBDE) : (area of quadrilateral DECA) = ?
Solution:
Let AB = 8 unit and AD = 3 unit
⇒ BD = 8 – 3 = 5 unit
As we know,
If, ΔBDE∼ΔBAC
Area of ΔBDE/area of ΔBAC = (BD/AB)2
Area of ΔBDE/area of ΔBAC = (5/8)2 = 25/64
Let area of ΔBDE = 25 unit and area of ΔBAC = 64 unit
Area of quadrilateral DECA = area of ΔBAC – area of ΔBDE = 64 – 25 = 39 unit
Area of ΔBDE : Area of quadrilateral DECA = 25 : 39

Question: If in ΔPQR. ∠P = 120°, PS ⊥ QR at S and PQ + QS = SR, then the measure of ∠Q is:
Solution:
Let take a point T on SR such that QS = ST
Join P to T
In ΔQPT
If QS = ST, and PS is perpendicular to QT, then we can say ΔQPT is a isosceles triangle.
PQ = PT
∠PQT = ∠PTQ
⇒ PQ + QS = SR
⇒ PT + QS = ST + TR
⇒ PT + QS = QS + TR
PT = TR
∠TPR = ∠TRP
Let ∠TPR = ∠TRP = θ
⇒ ∠TPR + TRP = ∠PTQ
⇒ ∠PTQ = θ + θ = 2θ
∠PQT = ∠PTQ = 2θ
In ΔPQR
∠PQR + ∠ QRP + ∠RPQ = 180°
⇒ 2θ + θ + 120° = 180°
⇒ 3θ = 180° – 120° = 60°
⇒ θ = 60°/3 = 20°
∠Q = 2θ = 2 × 20° = 40°

Question: The value of \(\frac{{2\left( {{{\sin }^6}\theta \; + \;{{\cos }^6}\theta } \right) - 3\left( {{{\sin }^4}\theta \; + \;{{\cos }^4}\theta } \right)}}{{{{\cos }^4}\theta - {{\sin }^4}\theta - 2{{\cos }^2}\theta }}\)is :
Solution:
Short Trick :
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{2\left( {{{\sin }^6}\theta \; + \;{{\cos }^6}\theta } \right) - 3\left( {{{\sin }^4}\theta \; + \;{{\cos }^4}\theta } \right)}}{{{{\cos }^4}\theta - {{\sin }^4}\theta - 2{{\cos }^2}\theta }}\)
⇒ \(\frac{{2\left( {{{\sin }^6}0^\circ \; + \;{{\cos }^6}0^\circ } \right) - 3\left( {{{\sin }^4}0^\circ \; + \;{{\cos }^4}0^\circ } \right)}}{{{{\cos }^4}0^\circ - {{\sin }^4}0^\circ - 2{{\cos }^2}0^\circ }}\)
⇒ [2(0 + 1) – 3(0 + 1)]/(1 – 0 – 2)
⇒ (2 – 3)/( - 1)
⇒ ( - 1)/( - 1)
⇒ 1
Detailed Solution
\(\frac{{2\left( {{{\sin }^6}\theta \; + \;{{\cos }^6}\theta } \right) - 3\left( {{{\sin }^4}\theta \; + \;{{\cos }^4}\theta } \right)}}{{{{\cos }^4}\theta - {{\sin }^4}\theta - 2{{\cos }^2}\theta }}\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{2\left[ {{{\left( {si{n^2}{\rm{\theta }}} \right)}^3}\; + \;{{(co{s^2}{\rm{\theta }})}^3}} \right] - 3\left( {{{\sin }^4}\theta \; + \;{{\cos }^4}\theta } \right)}}{{\left( {{{\cos }^2}\theta \; + \;{{\sin }^2}\theta } \right)\left( {{{\cos }^2}\theta - {{\sin }^2}\theta } \right) - 2co{s^2}{\rm{\theta }}}}\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{2\left[ {\left( {si{n^2}{\rm{\theta }}\; + \;co{s^2}{\rm{\theta }}} \right)\left( {si{n^4}{\rm{\theta }}\; + \;co{s^4}{\rm{\theta }} - si{n^2}{\rm{\theta }}co{s^2}{\rm{\theta }}} \right)} \right] - 3\left( {{{\sin }^4}\theta \; + \;{{\cos }^4}\theta } \right)}}{{(co{s^2}{\rm{\theta }} - si{n^2}{\rm{\theta }} - 2co{s^2}{\rm{\theta }})}}\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{\left[ {2\left( {si{n^4}{\rm{\theta }}\; + \;co{s^4}{\rm{\theta }}) - 2(si{n^2}{\rm{\theta }}co{s^2}{\rm{\theta }}} \right)} \right] - 3\left( {{{\sin }^4}\theta \; + \;{{\cos }^4}\theta } \right)}}{{\left( { - si{n^2}{\rm{\theta }} - co{s^2}{\rm{\theta }}} \right)}}\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{ - \left( {si{n^4}{\rm{\theta }}\; + \;co{s^4}{\rm{\theta }}\; + \;2si{n^2}{\rm{\theta }}co{s^2}{\rm{\theta }}} \right)}}{{ - \left( {si{n^2}\theta \; + \;co{s^2}\theta } \right)}}\)
⇒ (sin2 θ + cos2 θ)2
⇒ 1

Question: The value of \(\frac{{{{\left( {4.6} \right)}^4} + {{\left( {5.4} \right)}^4} + {{\left( {24.84} \right)}^2}}}{{{{\left( {4.6} \right)}^2} + {{\left( {5.4} \right)}^2} + 24.84}}\) is:
Solution:
Formula used:
(a4 + b4 - a2b2) = (a2 + b2 + ab)(a2 + b2 - ab)
⇒ (a2 + b2 + ab)(a2 + b2 - ab)
⇒ {(a2 + b2)2 - (ab)2}
⇒ a4 + b4 + 2a2b2 - a2b2= (a4 + b4 + a2b2)
Calculation:
Let x = 4.6, y = 5.4 and xy = 4.6 × 5.4 = 24.84
⇒ (x4 + y4 + x2y2)/(x2 + y2 + xy)
(a4 + b4 - a2b2) = (a2 + b2 + ab)(a2 + b2 - ab)
⇒ [(x2 + y2 + xy) (x2 + y2 – xy)]/(x2 + y2 + xy)
⇒ x2 + y2 – xy
⇒ x2 + y2 – 2xy + xy
⇒ (x – y)2 + xy
⇒ (4.6 – 5.4)2 + 4.6 × 5.4
⇒ (-0.8)2 + 24.84
⇒ 0.64 + 24.84
⇒ 25.48

Question: In an office, 5/8 of the total numbers of employees are males and the rest are females, 2/5 of the number of males are non - technical workers while 2/3 of the number of females are technical workers. What fraction of the total number of employees are technical workers?
Solution:
Let the total number of employees in the office be x
Number of males in the office = x × (5/8) = 5x/8
Number of females in the office = x – (5x/8) = 3x/8
Number of males technical workers = (5x/8) × (1 – 2/5) = (5x/8) × (3/5) = 3x/8
Number of females technical workers = (3x/8) × (2/3) = x/4
Total number of technical workers = (3x/8) + (x/4) = 5x/8
∴ The fraction of the total number of employees are technical workers = (5x/8)/x = 5/8

Question: Sudha bought 80 articles at the same price. She sold some of them at 8% profit and the remaining at 12% loss resulting in an overall profit of 6%. The number of items sold at 8% profit is :
Solution:
Using Allegation method
8 (–12)
6
18 2
Required ratio of number of article sold at 8% profit to that of 12% loss = 18x : 2x = 9x : x
⇒ 9x + x = 80
⇒ 10x = 80
⇒ x = 80/10 = 8
⇒ 9x = 9 × 8 = 72

Question: The marked price of an article is Rs 1500. If two successive discounts, each of x%, on the market price is equal to a single discount of Rs 587.40, then what will be the selling price of article if a single discount of x% is given on the market price?
Solution:
MP of the article = Rs. 1500
Single discount = Rs. 587.40
Single equivalent discount percentage = (587.40/1500) × 100 = 39.16%
As we know,
Single equivalent discount of two successive discount of x% each
x + x – (x × x)/100
⇒ 2x – x2/100 = 39.16
⇒ 200x – x2 = 3916
⇒ x2 – 200x + 3916 = 0
⇒ x2 – 22x – 178x + 3916 = 0
⇒ x (x – 22) – 178 (x – 22) = 0
⇒ (x – 178) (x – 22) = 0
Taking,
(x – 178) = 0
⇒ x = 178 (not possible)
Again taking,
⇒ (x – 22) = 0
⇒ x = 22
So selling price of the article after getting only single 22% discount = 1500 × (78/100) = 1170

Question: In an examination, A obtained 10% more marks than B, B obtained 20% more marks than C and C obtained 32% less marks than D. If A obtained 272 more marks than C, then the marks obtained by B is:
Solution:
Let D obtained be 100x marks
Marks obtained by C = 100x × (68/100) = 68x
Marks obtained by B = 68x × (120/100) = 81.6x
Marks obtained by A = 81.6x × (110/100) = 89.76x
According to the question
89.76x – 68x = 272
⇒ 21.76x = 272
⇒ x = 272/21.76 = 12.5
Marks obtained by B = 12.5 × 81.6 = 1020

Question: What is the remainder when (127<sup>97</sup> + 97<sup>97</sup>) is divided by 32?
Solution:
As we know,
(a3 + b3) = (a + b) (a2 + b2 – ab)
Now, we can say (a3 + b3) is divisible by (a + b), similarly
(12797 + 9797) is divisible by (127 + 97) = 224
As we know, 224/32 = 7. So we can say remainder is 0.

Question: An article was sold at a profit of 14%. Had it been sold for Rs. 121 less, a loss of 8% would have been incurred. If the same article had been sold for Rs. 536.25, then the profit/loss percent would have been :
Solution:
Short Trick:

Loss percentage = [{(550 - 536.25)/550)} × 100] = 2.5%
Detailed Solution:
Let the cost price of the article be Rs. 100x
SP of the article if the article sold at 14% profit = 100x × (114/100)
= 114x
SP of the article if the article sold at 8% loss = 100x × (92/100) = 92x
According to the question
114x – 92x = 121
⇒ 22x = 121
⇒ x = 121/22 = 11/2
Cost Price of the article = 100 × (11/2) = Rs. 550
SP of the article = Rs. 536.25
Loss = 550 – 536.25 = 13.75
Loss percentage = (13.75/550) × 100 = 2.5%

Question: Two positive number differ by 2001. When the large number is divided by the smaller number, the quotient is 9 and the remainder is 41. The sum of the digits of the larger number is :
Solution:
Let the larger number be x and smaller number be y, then
x = 9y + 41 ----(1)
x – y = 2001
x = 2001 + y ----(2)
From equation (1) and equation (2)
9y + 41 = 2001 + y
⇒ 9y – y = 2001 – 41
⇒ 8y = 1960
⇒ y = 1960/8 = 245
From equation (2)
⇒ x = 2001 + 245 = 2246
So, larger number be 2246
Sum of digit of larger number = 2 + 2 + 4 + 6 = 14

Question: The base of a right pyramid is an equilateral triangle with area \(16\sqrt 3 c{m^2}\). If the area of one of its lateral faces is 30 cm<sup>2</sup>, then its height (in cm) is:
Solution:
Area of equilateral triangle ABC = 16√3 cm2
(√3/4) × a2 = 16 √3
a2 = 16 × 4
⇒ a = √(16 × 4) = 4 × 2
⇒ a = 8 cm = AB = BC = CA
In radius of the equilateral triangle (r) (OQ) = side/2√3 = 8/2√3 = 4/√3
Area of one of its lateral faces PBC = 30 cm2
As we know, lateral face is in triangular face so,
(1/2) × Base (side of equilateral triangle) × h = 30
(1/2) × 8 × PQ = 30
PQ = 30/4 = 15/2 cm
As we know,
Slant height of the pyramid (PQ) = 15/2 cm
PQ2 = OQ2 + OP2
⇒ (15/2)2 = (4/√3)2 + h2
⇒ h2 = (225/4) – (16/3)
⇒ h2 = (675 – 64)/12 = 611/12
⇒ h = √611/12
∴ The height of the pyramid is √611/12 cm.

Question: The average of 18 numbers is 37.5. If six numbers of average x are added to them, then the average of all the numbers increases by one. The value of x is :
Solution:
Average of 18 numbers = 37.5
Sum of 18 numbers = 37.5 × 18 = 675
Average of 6 numbers = x
Sum of 6 numbers = 6x
According to the question
675 + 6x = (18 + 6) × (37.5 + 1)
⇒ 675 + 6x = 24 × 38.5
⇒ 675 + 6x = 924
⇒ 6x = 924 – 675
⇒ 6x = 249
⇒ x = 249/6
⇒ x = 41.5

Question: If 2cos<sup>2</sup>θ + 3sin θ = 3, where 0° < θ <90°, then what is the value of sin<sup>2</sup>2θ + cos<sup>2</sup>θ + tan<sup>2</sup>2θ + cosec<sup>2</sup>2θ
Solution:
2cos2θ + 3sin θ = 3
⇒ 2(1 – sin2 θ) + 3 sin θ – 3 = 0
⇒ 2 – 2sin2 θ + 3 sin θ – 3 = 0
⇒ 2sin2 θ – 3 sin θ + 1 = 0
⇒ 2sin2 θ – 2sin θ - sin θ + 1 = 0
⇒ 2sin θ (sin θ – 1) – 1(sin θ - 1) = 0
⇒ (2sin θ – 1) (sin θ – 1) = 0
Taking,
⇒ sin θ – 1 = 0
⇒ sin θ = 1
⇒ sin θ = sin 90
⇒ θ = 90
Taking,
⇒ 2sin θ – 1 = 0
⇒ sin θ = 1/2
⇒ sin θ = sin 30
⇒ θ = 30
sin22θ + cos2θ + tan22θ + cosec22θ
⇒ sin260 + cos230 + tan260 + cosec260
⇒ (√3/2)2 + (√3/2)2 + (√3)2 + (2/√3)2
⇒ 35/6

Question: Pipes A and B are filling pipes while pipe C is an emptying pipe. A and B can fill a tank in 72 and 90 minutes respectively. When all the three pipes are opened together, the tank gets filled in 2 hours. A and B are opened together for 12 minutes, then closed and C is opened. The tank will be empty after:
Solution:
2 hr = 120 minutes
Total work = 360
Let efficiency of C be x, then
5 + 4 + x = 3
⇒ x = 9 – 3
⇒ x = -6
Work done by pipe A and B in 12 minutes = (5 + 4) × 12 = 108
The tank empty by pipe C in = 108/6 = 18 minutes

Question: What is the area (in square units) of the triangular region enclosed by the graphs of the equations x + y = 3, 2x + 5y = 12 and the x - axis?
Solution:
As we know,
x/a + y/b = 1
So,
⇒ x + y = 3
⇒ x/3 + y/3 = 1
So co - ordinate of line x + y = 3 are (3, 0) and (0, 3).
⇒ 2x + 5y = 12
⇒ 2x/12 + 5y/12 = 1
⇒ x/6 + y/2.4 = 1
So co - ordinate of line 2x + 5y = 12 are (6, 0) and (0, 2.4).
From the following graph
Let the intersecting point of line x + y = 3 and 2x + 5y = 12 is Q.
⇒ x + y = 3 ----(1)
⇒ 2x + 5y = 12 ----(2)
From equation (1) and equation (2)
x = 1 and y = 2
Co - ordinate of point Q is (1, 2)
Now, we have to find area of triangle AOB.
In ΔAOB
Base if triangle AB = OB – OA
⇒ AB = 6 – 3 = 3
Height of the triangle QP = 2
Area of ΔAOB = (1/2) × AB × QP
∴ Area of ΔAOB = (1/2) × 3 × 2 = 3

Question: A, B and C started a business. Thrice the investment of A is equal to twice the investment of B and also equal to four times the investment of C. If C’s share out of the total profit is Rs. 4,863, then the share of A in the profit is :
Solution:
Let money invested by A, B and C are 3x, 2x and 4x respectively.
Let, 3x = 2x = 4x = k
Ratio of money of A, B and C = k/3 : k/2 : k/4
Ratio of money of A, B and C = 12k/3 : 12k/2 : 12k/4 = 4k : 6k : 3k
Profit of A, B and C = 4k : 6k : 3k
⇒ 3k = 4863
⇒ k = 4863/3 = 1621
Profit share of A = 4k = 4 × 1621 = 6484

Question: The bisector of ∠A is ΔABC meets BC in D. If AB = 15 cm, AC = 13 cm and BC = 14 cm, then DC = ?
Solution:
If bisector of ∠A is ΔABC meets BC in D, then
DC/BD = AC/AB
DC/BD = 13/15
Ratio of DC : BD = 13x : 15x
BC = BD + DC
14 = 15x + 13x
⇒ 14 = 28x
⇒ x = 14/28
⇒ x = 1/2
⇒ DC = 13x = 13/2 = 6.5

Question: A vessel contains a 32 litres solution of acid and water in which the ratio of acid and water is 5 ∶ 3 If 12 litres of the solution is taken out and \(7\frac{1}{2}\) litres of water are added to it, then what is the ratio of acid and water in the resulting solution?
Solution:
Given:
The total quantity of solution = 32 litres
The ratio of acid and water = 5 ∶ 3
Calculation:
Quantity of solution = 32 litres
Remaining quantity of solution = 32 – 12 = 20 litres
Quantity of water in the solution = 20 × (3/8) = 7.5
Quantity of acid in the solution = 20 – 7.5 = 12.5
Quantity of water after adding 7.5 litres = 7.5 + 7.5 = 15 litres
Ratio of acid to water = 12.5 ∶ 15 = 5 ∶ 6
∴ The ratio of acid and water in the resulting solution is 5 ∶ 6.

Question: A solid cylinder of base radius 12 cm and height 15 cm is melted and recast into n toys each in the shape of a right circular cone of height 9 cm mounted on a hemisphere of radius 3 cm. The value of n is:
Solution:
Given, Radius of cylinder = 12 cm and height of cylinder = 15 cm
Radius of cone = radius of hemisphere (r) = 3 cm and height of cone (h) = 9 cm
As we know,
Volume of cylinder = πR2H
Volume of toys = Volume of cone + Volume of hemisphere
Volume of toys = (1/3) πr2h + (2/3) πr3
According to the question
n × [(1/3) πr2h + (2/3) πr3] = πR2H
⇒ n × π × 32 × [(1/3) × 9 + (2/3) × 3] = π × 122× 15
⇒ n [3 + 2] = (144 × 15)/9
⇒ n = (16 × 15)/5
⇒ n = 48

Question: A 15 m deep well with radius 2.8 m is dug and the earth taken out from it is spread evenly to form a platform of breadth 8 m and height 1.5 m. What will be the length of the platform? (Take π = 22/7)
Solution:
Height of the well H = 15 m and radius of the well r = 2.8 m
Let the length of the platform be l m
Breadth of the platform b = 8 m
Height of the platform h = 1.5 m
According to the question
lbh = πr2h
l × 8 × 1.5 = (22/7) × 2.8 × 2.8 × 15
⇒ l = (22 × 2.8 × 2.8 × 15)/(8 × 1.5 × 7)
⇒ l = 30.8 m
Length of the platform is 30.8 m

Question: If 5√5 x<sup>3</sup> + 2√2 y<sup>3</sup>= (Ax + √2y)(Bx<sup>2</sup> + 2y<sup>2</sup> + Cxy), then what is the value of (A<sup>2</sup> + B<sup>2</sup> – C<sup>2</sup>)?
Solution:
Given:
5√5 x3 + 2√2 y3= (Ax + √2y)(Bx2 + 2y2 + Cxy)
Formula Used:
(a3 + b3) = (a + b) (a2 + b2 – ab)
Calculation:
5√5 x3 + 2√2 y3 = (Ax + √2y)(Bx2 + 2y2 + Cxy)
⇒ (√5 x)3 + (√2 y)3 = (Ax + √2y)(Bx2 + 2y2 + Cxy)
⇒ (√5 x + √2 y)(5x2 + 2y2 - √10 xy) = (Ax + √2 y)(Bx2 + 2y2 + Cxy)
On comparing,
⇒ A = √5, B = 5, C = - √10
(A2 + B2 – C2) = (5 + 25 – 10)
⇒ 20
∴ The value of (A2 + B2 – C2) is 20.

Question: If the measure of each exterior angle of a regular polygon is \(\left( {51\frac{3}{7}} \right)^\circ ,\) then the ratio of the number of its diagonals to the number of its sides is:
Solution:
As we know,
Number of sides in the polygon = 360/exterior angle = \(\frac{{360}}{{\left( {51\frac{3}{7}} \right)}} = \frac{{360}}{{\frac{{360}}{7}}} = 7\)
Number of diagonal = [n (n – 3)]/2 = [7 (7 – 3)]/2 = [7 × 4]/2 =14
Required ratio = 14 : 7 = 2 : 1

Question: A person covers 40% of the distance from A to B at 8 km/h, 40% of the remaining distance at 9 km/h and the rest at 12 km/h. His average speed (in km/h) for the journey is:
Solution:
Let the total distance be 100 km
40% of the total distance = 100 × (40/100) = 40 km
40% of the remaining distance = (100 – 40) × (40/100) = 60 × (40/100) = 24 km
Remaining distance = 100 – 40 – 24 = 36 km
As we know,
Average speed = total distance/total time
Required time to cover 40% distance with the speed of 8 km/hr = 40/8 = 5 hr
Required time to cover 40% of the remaining with the speed of 9 km/hr = 24/9 = 8/3 hr
Required time to cover rest distance with the speed of 12 km/hr = 36/12 = 3 hr
∴ Average speed = 100/(5 + 8/3 + 3) = 100/[(15 + 8 + 9)/3] = (100 × 3)/32 = 75/8 \(9\frac{3}{8}\)km/hr

Question: In ΔABC, D and E are the points on AB and AC respectively such that AD × AC = AB × AE. If ∠ADE = ∠ACB + 30° and ∠ABC = 78°, then ∠A = ?
Solution:
From the following figure if AD × AC = AB × AE or
⇒ AD/AB = AE/AC
Now, we can say ΔADE ∼ ΔABC, so
∠ABC = ∠ADE and ∠ACB = ∠AED
⇒ ∠ABC = ∠ADE = 78°
⇒ ∠ADE = ∠ACB + 30°
⇒ ∠ACB = 78° – 30° = 48°
As we know,
∠A + ∠B + ∠C = 180°
⇒ ∠A + 78° + 48° = 180°
⇒ ∠A = 180° – 126° = 54°

Question: The value of \(\frac{{\sin \theta \; + \;cos\theta - 1}}{{\sin \theta - cos\theta \; + \;1}} \times \frac{{{{\tan }^2}\theta \left( {cose{c^2}\theta - 1} \right)}}{{sec\theta - tan\theta }}\) is:
Solution:
Short Trick :
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{\sin \theta \; + \;cos\theta - 1}}{{\sin \theta - cos\theta \; + \;1}} \times \frac{{{{\tan }^2}\theta \left( {cose{c^2}\theta - 1} \right)}}{{sec\theta - tan\theta }}\)
Put θ = 45
⇒ [{(1/√2 + 1/√2) – 1}/(1/√2 – 1/√2 + 1)] × [{1 (2 – 1)}/(√2 – 1)]
⇒ (√2 – 1)/(√2 – 1)
⇒ 1
Detailed Solution :
As we know,
cosec2θ – 1 = cot2 θ
⇒ sec2θ – tan2θ = 1
⇒ tanθ cotθ = 1
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{\sin \theta \; + \;cos\theta - 1}}{{\sin \theta - cos\theta \; + \;1}} \times \frac{{{{\tan }^2}\theta \left( {cose{c^2}\theta - 1} \right)}}{{sec\theta - tan\theta }}\)
Divided by cosθ in (sinθ + cosθ – 1)/(sinθ – cosθ + 1)
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{tan{\rm{\theta \;}} + {\rm{\;}}1 - {\rm{sec\theta }}}}{{tan{\rm{\theta }} - 1{\rm{\;}} + {\rm{\;sec\theta }}}} \times \frac{{{{\tan }^2}\theta \;co{t^2}{\rm{\theta }}}}{{sec\theta - tan\theta }}\)
or we can write
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{sec{\rm{\theta }} - {\rm{tan\theta }} - 1}}{{1 - sec{\rm{\theta }} - {\rm{tan\theta }}}} \times \frac{{{{\tan }^2}\theta \;co{t^2}{\rm{\theta }}}}{{sec\theta - tan\theta }}\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{\left( {sec{\rm{\theta }} - {\rm{tan\theta }}} \right) - \left( {{\rm{se}}{{\rm{c}}^2}{\rm{\theta }} - {\rm{ta}}{{\rm{n}}^2}{\rm{\theta }}} \right)}}{{1 - sec{\rm{\theta }} - {\rm{tan\theta }}}} \times \frac{1}{{sec\theta - tan\theta }}\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{\left( {sec{\rm{\theta }} - {\rm{tan\theta }}} \right) - \left[ {\left( {{\rm{sec\theta }} - {\rm{tan\theta }}} \right)\left( {{\rm{sec\theta \;}} + {\rm{\;tan\theta }}} \right)} \right]}}{{1 - sec{\rm{\theta }} - {\rm{tan\theta }}}} \times \frac{1}{{sec\theta - tan\theta }}\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{\left( {sec{\rm{\theta }} - {\rm{tan\theta }}} \right)\left[ {1 - \left( {{\rm{sec\theta \;}} + {\rm{\;tan\theta }}} \right)} \right]}}{{1 - sec{\rm{\theta }} - {\rm{tan\theta }}}} \times \frac{1}{{sec\theta - tan\theta }}\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{\left( {sec{\rm{\theta }} - {\rm{tan\theta }}} \right)\left[ {1 - {\rm{sec\theta }} - {\rm{tan\theta }}} \right]}}{{1 - sec{\rm{\theta }} - {\rm{tan\theta }}}} \times \frac{1}{{sec\theta - tan\theta }}\)
⇒ 1

Question: A certain sum amounts to Rs. 4,205.55 at 15% p.a in \(2\frac{2}{5}\) years, interest compounded yearly. The sum is:
Two numbers are in the ratio 3 : 5. If 13 is subtracted from each, the new numbers are in the ratio 10 : 21. If 15 is added to each of the original numbers, then the ratio becomes:
Solution:
Ratio of two numbers are = 3x : 5x
According to the question
(3x – 13)/(5x – 13) = 10/21
⇒ 21 (3x – 13) = 10 (5x – 13)
⇒ 63x – 273 = 50x – 130
⇒ 63x – 50x = 273 – 130
⇒ 13x = 143
⇒ x = 143/13
⇒ x = 11
First number = 3x = 3 × 11 = 33
Second number = 5x = 5 × 11 = 55
If 15 add in each number than ratio of two number = (33 + 15) : (55 + 15) = 48 : 70 = 24 : 35

Question: A sum of Rs. 10,500 amounts to Rs. 13,825 in \(3\frac{4}{5}\) years at a certain rate per cent per annum simple interest. What will be the simple interest on the same sum for 5 years at double the earlier rate?
Solution:
P = 10,500 and A = 13,825 and t = \(3\frac{4}{5}\) = 19/5
SI = 13,825 – 10,500 = 3,325
As we know,
SI = Prt/100
⇒ 3325 = [10,500 × r × 19/5]/100
⇒ r = 3325 × 5/19 × 1/105
⇒ r = 25/3
If rate of interest is double, then new interest rate = (25/3) × 2 = 50/3
SI = [10,500 × (50/3) × 5]/100
⇒ SI = 8,750
Short trick :
P = 10,500 and A = 13,825 and t = \(3\frac{4}{5}\) = 19/5
SI = 13,825 – 10,500 = 3,325
Simple interest for 19/5 year = 3325
Simple interest for 1 year = 3325 × (5/19) = 875
If rate of interest is double, then simple interest = 875 × 2 = 1750
Simple interest for 5 years = 1750 × 5 = 8750

Question: The graph of the equations 5x – 2y + 1 = 0 and 4y – 3x + 5 = 0, intersect at the point p(α, β). What is the value of (2α – 3β)?
If \(\frac{{3\left( {{x^2} + 1} \right) - 7x}}{{3x}} = 6,\) x ≠ 0, then the value of \(\sqrt x + \frac{1}{{\sqrt x }}\;is:\)

A person invested one - fourth of the sum of Rs. 25,000 at a certain rate of simple interest and the rest at 4% p.a. higher rate. If the total interest received for 2 years is Rs. 4,125, what is the rate at which the second sum was invested?
Solution:
Rate interest of rate be r%, then
According to the question
[25000 × 1/4 × r × 2]/100 + [25000 × 3/4 × (r + 4) × 2]/100 = 4125
⇒ 125r + 375r + 1500 = 4125
⇒ 500r = 4125 – 1500
⇒ 500r = 2625
⇒ r = 2625/500
⇒ r = 5.25%
∴ Required interest rate = r + 4 = 5.25 + 4 = 9.25%
Alternate Method
ATQ, for (3/4) th of the amount an extra 4% interest is paid.
That is, PRT/100 + 4(3P/4)T/100 = 4125
PT/100 × [R + 3] = 4125
R + 3 = 412500/(25000 × 2) = 8.25%
Rate of investment of second part = R + 4 = 8.25 + 1 = 9.25%
∴ Required interest rate IS 9.25%.

Question: ab(a – b) + bc(b – c) + ca(c – a) is equal to :
Solution:
Short trick :
ab(a – b) + bc(b – c) + ca(c – a)
Let a = 1, b = 2 and c = 3, then
⇒ 1 × 2 (1 – 2) + 2 × 3 (2 – 3) + 3 × 1 (3 – 1)
⇒ 2 × (–1) + 6 × ( - 1) + 3 × 2
⇒ –2 – 6 + 6
⇒ –2
With the help of option 2
(b – a)(b – c)(c – a)
⇒ (2 – 1)(2 – 3)(3 – 1)
⇒ 1 × ( - 1) × 2
⇒ –2

Question: Basir’s working hours per day were increased by 15% and his wages per hour were increased by 20%. By how much percent did his daily earnings increase?
Solution:
Short Trick :
15 + 20 + [(20 × 15)/100]
⇒ 35 + 3
⇒ 38%
Detailed Solution :
Let the number be x
Number will be after increment = x × (115/100) × (120/100) = 1.38x
Number increased by = 1.38x – x = 0.38x
Number increased by (in%) = (0.38x/x) × 100 = 38%

Question: The value of \(\sqrt {28 + 10\sqrt 3 } - \sqrt {7 - 4\sqrt 3 }\) is closest to:
A Person buys 80 kg of rice and sells it at a profit of as much money as he paid for 30 kg. His profit per cent is:
Solution:
According to the question
80 SP – 80 CP = 30 CP
80 SP = 80 CP + 30 CP
80 SP = 110 CP
SP : CP = 11 : 8
SP = 11 and CP = 8
Profit = 11 – 8 = 3
∴ Profit % = (3/8) × 100 = \(37\frac{1}{2}\;\%\)

Question: A right prism has height 18cm and its base is a triangle with sides 5cm, 8 cm and 12 cm. What is its lateral surface area (in cm<sup>2</sup>)?
Solution:
Height of the prism = 18 cm
Sides of the triangle are 5 cm, 8 cm and 12 cm.
As we know,
Lateral surface area of prism = Perimeter of base × height
Lateral surface area of prism = (5 + 8 + 12) × 18 = 25 × 18 = 450 cm2

Question: The radius of the base of a right circular cylinder is 3 cm and its curved surface are is 60 πcm<sup>2</sup>. The volume of the cylinder (in cm<sup>3</sup>) is:
Solution:
Radius of the cylinder r = 3 cm
Curved surface area of cylinder = 60 π
2 πrh = 60 π
⇒ 2 π × 3 × h = 60 π
⇒ h = 60 π/6 π = 10
Volume of the cylinder = πr2h = π × 3 × 3 × 10 = 90 π

Question: A man can row a distance of 900 metres against the stream in 12 minutes and returns to the starting point in 9 minutes. What is the speed (in km/h) of the man in still water?
Solution:
Let the speed of the boat be x km/hr and speed of the stream be y km/hr
According to the question
x - y = (900 × 60)/(12 × 1000)
⇒ x - y = 4.5 km/hr ----(1)
⇒ x + y = (900 × 60)/(9 × 1000)
⇒ x + y = 6 km/hr ----(2)
Add equation (1) and equation (2)
⇒ 2x = 10.5
⇒ x = 5.25 km/hr
∴ Speed of the man in still water = 5.25 km/hr or \(5\frac{1}{4}\) km/hr

Question: A certain loan was returned in two equal half - yearly instalments each of Rs. 6,760. If the rate of interest was 8% p.a., compounded yearly, how much was the interest paid on the loan?
Solution:
Formula Used:
Installments in case of compound interest is
P = x/(1 + r/100) + x/(1 + r/100)2 ....x/(1 + r/100)n
Calculation:
Given, (each installment) x = 6,760, r = 4%, n = 2 and P = ?
P = [x/(1 + r/100)] + [x/(1 + r/100)2]
⇒ P = [6,760/(1 + 4/100)] + [6,760/(1 + 4/100)2]
⇒ P = [6760 × (25/26)] + [6760 × (25/26) × (25/26)]
⇒ P = 6500 + 6250 = 12750
Total Rs paid = 6760 × 2 = 13520
∴ Interest paid = 13520 – 12750 = 770

Shortcut Trick
Interest rate = 8% p. a
Interest rate for 6 month = 8/2 = 4%
⇒ 4% = 1/25

Total instalment = 6760 × 2 = 13520
⇒ 1352 unit = 13520
⇒ 1 unit = 10
⇒ (1352 – 1275 = 77) unit = 77 × 10 = 770

In the question, it is stated that the installment is paid half-yearly. So, we take the rate of interest as r%/2. Here, that is 8/2 = 4% for every installment.

Question: The radius and the height of a right circular cone are in the ration 5 : 12. Its curved surface area is 816.4 cm<sup>2</sup>. What is the volume (in cm<sup>3</sup>) of the cone? (Take π = 3.14)
Solution:
Ratio of radius to height of the cone = 5x : 12x
As we know,
Curved surface area of the cone = πrl
l2 = r2 + h2
⇒ l2 = (5x)2 + (12x)2
⇒ l2 = 25x2 + 144x2 = 169x2
⇒ l = √169x2
⇒ l = 13x
Curved surface area of the cone = πrl
πrl = 816.4
⇒ 3.14 × 5x × 13x = 816.4
⇒ x2 = 816.4/(3.14 × 5 × 13)
⇒ x2 = 4
⇒ x = √4
⇒ x = 2
Radius of the cone = 5 × 2 = 10
Height of the cone = 12 × 2 = 24
Volume of the cone = (1/3) × πr2h = (1/3) × 3.14 × 10 × 10 × 24 = 2512 cm3

Question: ΔABC, BE ⊥ AC, CD ⊥ AB and BE and CD intersect each other at O. The bisectors of ∠OBC and ∠OCB meet At P. If ∠BPC = 148°, then what is the measure of ∠A?
Solution:
As we know,
∠BPC = 90° + ∠BOC/2
⇒ 148° = 90° + ∠BOC/2
⇒ ∠BOC/2 = 148° – 90° = 58°
⇒ ∠BOC = 58° × 2 = 116°
⇒ ∠BOC = ∠DOE = 116° [opposite angle]
In quadrilateral ADOE
∠DAE + ∠ADO + ∠DOE + ∠OEA = 360
⇒ ∠DAE + 90° + 116° + 90° = 360°
⇒ ∠DAE = 360° – 296° = 64°

Question: A, B and C spend 80%, 85% and 75% of their incomes, respectively. If their savings are in the ratio 8 : 9 : 20 and the difference between the incomes of A and C is Rs. 18,000, then the income of B is:
Solution:
The ratio of saving of A, B and C = 8k : 9k : 20K
Let the income of A, B and C are x, y and z respectively.
According to the question
x × (20/100) = 8k
⇒ x = 8 × (100/20) = 40k
⇒ y × (15/100) = 9k
⇒ y = 9k × (100/15) = 60k
⇒ z × (25/100) = 20k
⇒ z = 20k × (100/25) = 80k
Income ratio of A, B and C = 40k : 60k : 80k = 2k : 3k : 4K
⇒ 4k – 2k = 18000
⇒ 2k = 18000
⇒ k = 18000/2 = 9000
⇒ 3k = 9000 × 3 = 27000

Question: 25 persons can complete a work in 60 days. They started the work. 10 persons left the work after x days. If the whole work was completed in 80 days, then what is the value of x?
Solution:
As we know,
Total work = total work
According to the question
25 × 60 = 25 × x + 15 × (80 – x)
⇒ 1500 = 25x + 1200 – 15x
⇒ 25x – 15x = 1500 – 1200
⇒ 10x = 300
⇒ x = 30
Note : In the actual exam, the given options were incorrect, therefore, we have modified them and have provided the solution accordingly

Question: A sector of radius 10.5 cm with the central angle 120° is folded to form a cone by joining the two bounding radii of the sector. What is the volume (in cm<sup>3</sup>)of the cone so formed?
Solution:
Radius of sector r = 10.5 cm
Arc length of sector whose angle is 120° = 2 πr × (θ/360) = 2 × (22/7) × 10.5 × (120/360)
⇒ 2 × (22/7) × 10.5 × (1/3)
⇒ 22
Arc length of sector whose angle 120° = 22
If we make cone from sector then,
Slant height of the cone = radius of sector = 10.5 cm
Circumference of the cone = 22
2 πr = 22
⇒ 2 × (22/7) × r = 22
⇒ r = 7/2 = 3.5 cm
As we know,
⇒ l2 = r2 + h2
⇒ (10.5)2 = (3.5)2 + h2
⇒ h2 = 110.25 – 12.25
⇒ h = √98
⇒ h = 7 √2 cm
Volume of the cone = (1/3) × πr2h = (1/3) × π × (7/2) × (7/2) × 7 √2 \(= \frac{{343\sqrt 2 }}{{12}}\pi\)

Question: If \(\frac{{\sin \theta }}{{1 + cos\theta }} + \frac{{1 + \cos \theta }}{{sin\theta }} = \frac{4}{{\sqrt 3 }},0^\circ < \theta < 90^\circ ,\) then the value of (secθ + tanθ)<sup>-1</sup> is:
Solution:
\(\frac{{\sin \theta }}{{1 + cos\theta }} + \frac{{1 + \cos \theta }}{{sin\theta }} = \frac{4}{{\sqrt 3 }}\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{si{n^2}\theta + {{\left( {1 + cos\theta } \right)}^2}}}{{\left( {1 + cos\theta } \right)sin\theta }} = \frac{4}{{\sqrt 3 }}\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{si{n^2}\theta + 1 + co{s^2}\theta + 2cos\theta }}{{\left( {1 + cos\theta } \right)sin\theta }} = \frac{4}{{\sqrt 3 }}\)
\(\Rightarrow {\rm{}}\frac{{2 + 2cos\theta }}{{\left( {1 + cos\theta } \right)sin\theta }} = \frac{4}{{\sqrt 3 }}\)
⇒ 2(1 + cos θ)/(1 + cos θ)sin θ = 4/√3
⇒ 2/sinθ = 4/√3
⇒ cosec θ = 2/√3
⇒ cosec θ = cosec 60
⇒ θ = 60
⇒ (tanθ + secθ)-1
⇒ 1/(tanθ + secθ)
1/(tan60 + sec60)
1/(2 + √3)
[1(2 + √3)] × [(2 - √3)/(2 - √3)]
(2 - √3)/(4 – 3)
2 - √3

Question: If x + y + z = 6, xyz = - 10 and x<sup>2</sup> + y<sup>2</sup> + z<sup>2</sup> = 30, then what is the value of (x<sup>3</sup> + y<sup>3</sup> + z<sup>3</sup>)?
Solution:
(x + y + z)2 = x2 + y2 + z2 + 2(xy + yz + zx)
⇒ 62 = 30 + 2(xy + yz + zx)
⇒ 2(xy + yz + zx) = 36 – 30 = 6
⇒ (xy + yz + zx) = 6/2 = 3
⇒ (xy + yz + zx) = 3
⇒ x3 + y3 + z3 – 3xyz = (x + y + z) [(x + y + z)2 – 3(xy + yz + zx)]
⇒ x3 + y3 + z3 – 3 × ( - 10) = 6 [62 – 3 × 3]
⇒ x3 + y3 + z3 + 30 = 6 (36 – 9)
⇒ x3 + y3 + z3 + 30 = 6 × 27
⇒ x3 + y3 + z3 = 162 – 30 = 132
⇒ x3 + y3 + z3 = 132

Question: In finding the HCF of two numbers by division method, the last divisor is 17 and the quotients are 1, 11 and 2, respectively. What is sum of the two numbers ?
Solution:
As we know,
Divided = Divisor × quotient + remainder
Divided = 17 × 2 + 0
Divided = 34
Again,
Divided = Divisor × quotient + remainder
Divided = 34 × 11 + 17
Divided = 374 + 17 = 391
Again,
Divided = Divisor × quotient + remainder
Divided = 391 × 1 + 34
Divided = 391 + 34 = 425
The two numbers are 425 and 391
Sum of two numbers = 425 + 391 = 816

Question: A student was asked to find the of \(9\frac{4}{9} \div 11\frac{1}{3}\rm \ of\ \frac{1}{6} + \left( {1\frac{1}{3} \times 1\frac{4}{5} \div \frac{3}{5}} \right) \times 2\frac{1}{6} \rm \ of\ \frac{2}{3} \div \frac{4}{3}\rm \ of\ \frac{2}{3}\). His answer was \(19\frac{1}{4}\) What is the difference between his answer and the correct answer?
Solution:
\(\Rightarrow 9\frac{4}{9} \div 11\frac{1}{3}\rm \ of\ \frac{1}{6} + \left( {1\frac{1}{3} \times 1\frac{4}{5} \div \frac{3}{5}} \right) \times 2\frac{1}{6}\ of\ \frac{2}{3} \div \frac{4}{3}\ of\ \frac{2}{3}\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{85}}{9} \div \frac{{34}}{3} \times \frac{1}{6}{\rm{\;}} + {\rm{\;}}\left( {\frac{4}{3} \times \frac{9}{5} \div \frac{3}{5}} \right) \times \frac{{13}}{6} \times \frac{2}{3} \div \frac{4}{3} \times \frac{2}{3}\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{85}}{9} \div \frac{{17}}{9}\; + \;\left( {\frac{4}{3} \times \frac{9}{5} \times \frac{5}{3}} \right) \times \frac{{13}}{9} \div \frac{4}{3} \times \frac{2}{3}\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{85}}{9} \times \frac{9}{{17}}\; + \;4 \times \frac{{13}}{9} \div \frac{8}{9}\)
⇒ 5 + 4 × (13/9) ÷ (9/8)
⇒ 5 + (13/2)
⇒ 23/2
Difference of \(19\frac{1}{4} = 77/4\) and 23/2 is = 77/4 – 23/2 = (77 – 46)/2 = 31/4 = \(7\frac{3}{4}\)

Question: A tank is in the form of a cuboid with length 12m. If 18 kilolitre of water is removed from it, the water level goes down by 30 cm. What is the width (in m) of the tank?
Solution:
Let the length of the tank = 12 m
Height of the tank = 30 cm = 30/100 m = 0.3 m
Let the width of the tank be b m
According to the question
12 × b × 0.3 = 18
b = 18/(12 × 0.3)
b = 5

Question: 35% of goods were sold at a profit of 65%, while the remaining were sold at x% loss. If the overall loss is 12%, then what is the value of x? (correct to one decimal place)
N solid metallic spherical balls are melted and recast into a cylindrical rod whose radius is 3 times that of a spherical ball and height is 4 times the radius of a spherical ball. The value of N is:
Solution:
As we know,
Volume of sphere = (4/3) πr3
Volume of cylinder = πr2h
Let the radius of spherical balls be r cm and height of spherical balls be h cm
Radius of cylindrical rod = 3r and height of cylindrical rod = 4r
According to the question
N × (4/3) × π × r3 = π (3r)2 × 4r
⇒ N = 27

Question: Given that (5x – 3)<sup>3</sup> + (2x + 5)<sup>3</sup> + 27(4 – 3x)<sup>3</sup> = 9(3 – 5x) (2x + 5) (3x – 4), then the value of (2x + 1) is:
Monika spends 72% of her income. If her income increases by 20% and savings increase by 15%, then her expenditure increases by: (correct to 1 decimal place)
Solution:
Let income of be 100x
Expenditure of Monika = 100x × (72/100) = 72x
Savings of Monika = 100x – 72x = 28x
New income of Monika = 100x × (120/100) = 120x
New savings of Monika = 28x × (115/100) = 32.2x
New expenditure of Monika = 120x – 32.2x = 87.8x
Her expenditure of Monika increased by =[(87.8x – 72x)/72x] × 100 = 21.9%

Question: In quadrilateral ABCD, ∠C = 72° and ∠D = 28°. The bisectors of ∠A and ∠B meet in O. What is the measure of ∠AOB?
Solution:
Short Trick:
As we know,
2∠AOB = ∠C + ∠D
⇒ 2∠AOB = 72° + 28°
⇒ ∠AOB = 100°/2 = 50°
Detailed Solution:
As we know,
∠A + ∠B + ∠C + ∠D = 360°
⇒ ∠A + ∠B + 72° + 28° = 360°
⇒ ∠A + ∠B = 360° – 100° = 260°
In ΔAOB
∠A/2 + ∠B/2 + ∠AOB = 180°
⇒ ∠A/2 + ∠B/2 + ∠AOB = 180°
⇒ ∠AOB = 180° - (∠A + ∠B)/2
⇒ ∠AOB = 180° – 260°/2
∴ ∠AOB = 180° – 130° = 50°

Question: A is as efficient as B and C together. Working together A and B can complete a work in 36 days and C alone can complete it in 60 days. A and C work together for 10 days. B alone will complete the remaining work in:
Solution:
Efficiency ratio of A to (B and C) = 1 : 1 ----(1)
Time ratio of (A and B) to C = 36 : 60 = 3 : 5
As we know,
Efficiency is inversely proportional to time.
Efficiency ratio of (A and B) to C = 5 : 3 ----(2)
Multiply by 4 in equation (1)
Efficiency ratio of A to (B and C) = 4 : 4 ----(3)
Now we can say, from equation (2) and equation (3)
Efficiency of A = 4 and efficiency of C = 3 and efficiency of B = 4 – 3 = 1
Total work = 3 × 60 = 180
Work done by A and C in done days = (4 + 3) × 10 = 7 × 10 = 70
Remaining work = 180 – 70 = 110
Remaining work done by B alone in = 110/1 = 110 days

Question: A sum is divided among A, B, C and D such that the ratio of the shares of A and B is 2 : 3, that of B and C is 1 : 2 and that of C and D 3 : 4. If the difference between the shares of A and D is Rs. 648, then find the sum of shares of A, B, C and D.
Solution:
Ratio of A to B = 2x : 3x ---(1)
Ratio of B to C = x : 2x ---(2)
Ratio of C to D = 3x : 4x ---(3)
Multiply by 3 in equation (2) and multiply by 2 in equation (3)
Ratio of A, B, C and D = 2x : 3x : 6x : 8x
⇒ 8x – 2x = 648
⇒ 6x = 648
⇒ x = 648/6
⇒ x = 108
Sum of shares = (2x + 3x + 6x + 8x) = 19 × 108 = 2052

Question: If a 10 - digit number 5432y1749x is divisible by 72, then what is the value of (5x – 4y)?
Solution:
Divisibility law of 8 ⇒ A number divisible by 8 if its last three digits are divisible by 8
Divisibility law of 9 ⇒ A number is divisible by 9 if the sum of its digit is divisible by 9.
10 - digit number 5432y1749x is divisible by 72, so we can say number divisible by 8 and 9 also
Last three - digit of the number 49x is divisible by 8 if x = 6
10 - digit number 5432y17496 is divisible by 9 if the sum of its digit is divisible by 9 so
⇒ 5 + 4 + 3 + 2 + y + 1 + 7 + 4 + 9 + 6
⇒ 41 + y
If we put y = 4 then number become 45 which is divisible by 9 so y = 4
Now,
⇒ 5x – 4y
⇒ 5 × 6 – 4 × 4
⇒ 30 – 16
⇒ 14

Question: In ΔPQR, ∠Q >∠R, PS is the bisector of ∠P and PT ⊥ QR. If ∠SPT = 28° and ∠R = 23°, then the measure of ∠Q is :
Solution:
Given:

∠Q >∠R
PT ⊥ QR
∠SPT = 28 and ∠R = 23°
PS is the bisector of ∠P i.e. ∠QPS = ∠SPR
Calculation:
In Δ PTS
∠PTS + ∠TPS + ∠PST = 180°
⇒ ∠PST = 180° - 118° = 62°
Now,
∠PST + ∠PSR = 180° (Linear pair)
⇒ ∠PSR = 118°
In Δ PSR
∠SPR = 180 - (118 + 23) = 39° = ∠QPS
In Δ PQS
∠Q = 180° - (39 + 62) = 79°

(∠Q - ∠R)/2 = ∠SPT
⇒ (∠Q – 23°)/2 = 28
⇒ (∠Q – 23°) = 28° × 2 = 56°
⇒ ∠Q = 56° + 23°
⇒ ∠Q = 79°

Question: A Sphere of maximum volume is cut out from a solid hemisphere. What is the ratio of the volume of the sphere to that of the remaining solid?
Solution:
As we know,
Volume of sphere = (4/3) × πr3
Volume of hemisphere = (2/3) × πr3
Let the radius of the hemisphere be r cm
Radius of the sphere which is cut out from hemisphere = r/2 cm
Volume of hemisphere = (2/3) × πr3
Volume of sphere = (4/3) × π × (r/2)3 = (4/3) × π × (r3/8) = (1/6) πr3
Volume of remaining solid = (2/3) × πr3 - (1/6) πr3 = (1/2) πr3
Ratio of the volume of the sphere to that of the remaining solid = (1/6) πr3 : (1/2) πr3 = 1 : 3

Question: If the selling price of an article is 32% more than its cost price and the discount offered on its marked price is 12%, then what is the ratio of its cost price to the marked price?
Solution:
Let the CP of the article be Rs. x
SP of article = x × (132/100) = 1.32x
MP of the article = 1.32x × (100/88) = 1.5x
∴ Required ratio of CP to MP = x : 1.5x = 2 : 3

Question: A shopkeeper allows 18% discount on the market price of an article and still makes a profit of 23% If he gains Rs, 18.40 on the sale of the article, then what is the marked price of the article?
Solution:
Let the CP of the article be 100x
SP of the article = (100x) × (123/100) = 123x
MP of the article = 123x × (100/82) = 150x
Profit = 123x – 100x = 23x
⇒ 23x = 18.40
⇒ x = 18.40/23 = 0.8
MP of the article = 150 × 0.8 = 120

Question: To cover a distance of 416 km, a train A takes \(2\frac{2}{3}\) hours more than train B. If the speed of A is doubled, it would take \(1\frac{1}{3}\) hours less than B. What is the speed (in km/h) of train A?
Solution:
Let the speed of the train A be x km/hr
Ratio of speed of the A before to after = x : 2x
As we know,
Time is inversely proportional to speed.
Ratio of time of A before to after to cover distance = 2x : x
Time difference = 2x – x = \(2\frac{2}{3} + 1\frac{1}{3}\)
⇒ x = 8/3 + 4/3
⇒ x = 12/3
⇒ x = 4 hr
Time taken by A to cover distance = 2x = 2 × 4 = 8 hr
Speed of train A = 416/8 = 52 km/hr

Question: A, B and C started a business with their capitals in the ratio 2 : 3 : 5. A increased his capital by 50% after 4 months, B increased his capital by \(33\frac{1}{3}\%\) after 6 months and C withdrew 50% of his capital after 8 months, from the start of the business. If the total profit at the end of a year was Rs. 86,800, then the difference between the shares of A and C in the profit was:
Solution:
As we know,
Profit = Money × Time
A, B and C started a business with their capitals in the ratio 2 : 3 : 5
Let A, B and C started a business with their capitals in the ratio 20k : 30k : 50k
Total money of A invested in the end of year = 20k × 4 + 20k × (3/2) × 8 = 80k + 240k = 320k
Total money of B invested in the end of year = 30k × 6 + 30k × (4/3) × 6 = 180k + 240k = 420k
Total money of C invested in the end of year = 50k × 8 + 50k × (1/2) × 4 = 400k + 100k = 500k
Profit ratio of A, B and C = 320k : 420k : 500k = 16k : 21k : 25K
⇒ 16k + 21k + 25k = 86800
⇒ 62k = 86800
⇒ k = 86800/62
⇒ k = 1400
⇒ 25k – 16k
⇒ 9k
⇒ 9 × 1400
⇒ 12600

Question: If sec θ + tan θ = p, (p > 1), then (cosec θ + 1)/(cosec θ – 1) = ?
Solution:
Detailed solution :
sec θ + tan θ = p ----(1)
As we know,
sec2 θ – tan2 θ = 1
⇒ (sec θ + tan θ) (sec θ – tan θ) = 1
⇒ (sec θ – tan θ) = 1/p ----(2)
Adding equation (1) and equation (2)
⇒ 2 sec θ = p + 1/p
⇒ 2 sec θ = (p2 + 1)/p
⇒ sec θ = (p2 + 1)/2p
⇒ cos θ = 2p/(p2 + 1)
As we know,
⇒ sin2 θ = 1 – cos2 θ
⇒ sin2 θ = 1 – [2p/(p2 + 1)]2
⇒ sin2 θ = [(p2 + 1)2 – 4p2]/(p2 + 1)2 = [p4 + 1 + 2p2 – 4p2]/(p2 + 1)2 = (p2 – 1)2/(p2 + 1)2
⇒ sin θ = √[(p2 – 1)2/(p2 + 1)2] = (p2 – 1)/(p2 + 1)
⇒ cosec θ = (p2 + 1)/(p2 – 1)
Dividendo and componendo.
⇒ (cosec θ + 1)/(cosec θ – 1) = (p2 + 1 + p2 – 1)/(p2 + 1 – p2 + 1) = 2p2/2 = p2
Short trick :
sec θ + tan θ = p
put θ = 45
⇒ p = sec45 + tan45
⇒ p = √2 + 1
Now, (cosec θ + 1)/(cosec θ – 1)
⇒ (cosec45 + 1)/(cosec45 – 1)
⇒ (√2 + 1)/(√2 – 1)
⇒ [(√2 + 1)/(√2 – 1)] × [(√2 + 1)/(√2 + 1)]
⇒ (√2 + 1)2
⇒ p2

Question: a, b and c are three fraction such that a < b < c. If c divided by a, the result is 9/2, which exceeds b by 23/6. The sum of a, b and c is 19/12. What is the value of (2a + b – c)?
The value cosec (67° + θ) – sec (23° – θ) + cos15° cos35° cosec55° cos60° cosec 75°.
Solution:
cosec (67° + θ) – sec (23° – θ) + cos15° cos35° cosec55° cos60° cosec 75°
⇒ cosec (67° + θ) – cosec [90° – (23° – θ)] + cos15° cos35° sec(90° – 55°) cos60° sec(90° – 75°)
⇒ cosec (67° + θ) – cosec(67° + θ) + cos15° cos35° sec35° cos60° sec15°

⇒ 1/2

Question: In a circle with centre O, ABCD is a cyclic quadrilateral and AC is diameter. Chords AB and DC are produced to meet at E. If ∠CAE = 34° and ∠E = 30°, then ∠CBD is equal to:
Solution:
Given, ∠CAE = 34, ∠E = 30
∠ADC = 90 [∵ AC is a diameter]
In ΔAEC
∠CAE + ∠AEC + ∠ACE = 180
⇒ 34 + 30 + ∠ACE = 180
⇒ ∠ACE = 180 – 64 = 116
As we know,
∠DCA + ACE = 180
⇒ ∠DCA + 116 = 180
⇒ ∠DCA = 180 – 116 = 64
In Δ DAC
∠DAC + ∠ ADC + ∠DCA = 180
⇒ ∠DAC + 90 + 64 = 180
⇒ ∠DAC = 180 – 90 – 64 = 26
As we know,
⇒ ∠DAC = ∠CBD = 26 [∵ angles are equal subtended by same arc]

Question: The value of \(0.4\bar 7\; + \;0.5\overline {03} - 0.3\bar 9\; \times \;0.\bar 8\) is:
Solution:
\(0.4\bar 7\; + \;0.5\overline {03} - 0.3\bar 9\; \times \;0.\bar 8\)
\(\Rightarrow 0.4\bar 7\; + \;0.5\overline {03} - \frac{{39 - 3}}{{90}}\; \times \;\frac{8}{9}\)
\(\Rightarrow 0.4\bar 7\; + \;0.5\overline {03} - \frac{{36}}{{90}}\; \times \;\frac{8}{9}\)
\(\Rightarrow 0.4\bar 7\; + \;0.5\overline {03} - \frac{{32}}{{90}}\)
\(\Rightarrow 0.4\bar 7\; + \;0.5\overline {03} - 0.3\bar 5\)

\(\Rightarrow \ 0.\;6\overline {25}\)
Or
\(\Rightarrow 0.4\bar 7\; + \;0.5\overline {03} - 0.3\bar 9\; \times \;0.\bar 8\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{47 - 4}}{{90}}\; + \;\frac{{503 - 5}}{{990}} - \frac{{39 - 3}}{{90}}\; \times \;\frac{8}{9}\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{43}}{{90}}\; + \;\frac{{498}}{{990}} - \frac{{36}}{{90}}\; \times \;\frac{8}{9}\)
\(\Rightarrow \frac{{43}}{{90}}\; + \;\frac{{498}}{{990}} - \frac{{32}}{{90}}\)
⇒ (473 + 498 – 352)/990
⇒ 619/990
\(\Rightarrow \ 0.\;6\overline {25}\)

Question: The radius of the base of a right circular cylinder is increased by 20% By what per cent should its height be reduced so that its volume remains the same as before?
Solution:
As we know,
Volume of the cylinder = πr2h
If radius increased by 20%, then new radius = r × (120/100) = 1.2r
Let height reduced by x% then new height = h × (100 – x)/100
According to the question
π(1.2r)2 × h × [(100 – x)/100] = πr2h
⇒ 1.44 [(100 – x)/100] = 1
⇒ (100 – x) = 100/1.44
⇒ x = 100 – 100/1.44
⇒ x = 44/1.44
⇒ x = \(30\frac{5}{9}\)
Short Trick :
20% = 1/5

Required Percentage = [(36 – 25)/36] × 100 = \(30\frac{5}{9}\)

Question: The LCM of two numbers x and y is 204 times their HCF. If their HCF is 12 and the difference between the numbers is 60, then x + y = ?
Solution:
HCF of x and y numbers = 12
Let x = 12a and y = 12b
Given,
12a – 12b = 60
⇒ (a – b) = 60/12
⇒ a – b = 5
LCM of x and y numbers = 12 × 204
⇒ 12ab = 12 × 204
⇒ ab = 204
Possible value of a and b whose difference is 5 can be 17 and 12
12a + 12b
⇒ 12 (a + b)
⇒ 12 (17 + 12)
⇒ 12 × 29
⇒ 348

Question: The value of \(\frac{{{{\sec }^2}\theta }}{{cose{c^2}\theta }}\; + \;\frac{{cose{c^2}\theta }}{{{{\sec }^2}\theta }} - \left( {{{\sec }^2}\theta \; + \;cose{c^2}\theta } \right)\) is:
Solution:
Short trick:
\(\frac{{{{\sec }^2}\theta }}{{cose{c^2}\theta }}\; + \;\frac{{cose{c^2}\theta }}{{{{\sec }^2}\theta }} - \left( {{{\sec }^2}\theta \; + \;cose{c^2}\theta } \right)\)
⇒ Put θ = 45
⇒ \(\frac{{{{\sec }^2}45}}{{cose{c^2}45}}\; + \;\frac{{cose{c^2}45}}{{{{\sec }^2}45}} - \left( {{{\sec }^2}45\; + \;cose{c^2}45} \right)\)
⇒ (√2/√2)2 + (√2/√2)2 – [(√2)2 + (√2)2]
⇒ 1 + 1 – [2 + 2]
⇒ 2 – 4
⇒ – 2
Detailed Solution:
\(\frac{{{{\sec }^2}\theta }}{{cose{c^2}\theta }}\; + \;\frac{{cose{c^2}\theta }}{{{{\sec }^2}\theta }} - \left( {{{\sec }^2}\theta \; + \;cose{c^2}\theta } \right)\)
⇒ \(\frac{{\frac{1}{{co{s^2}{\rm{\theta }}}}}}{{\frac{1}{{si{n^2}{\rm{\theta }}}}}}\; + \;\frac{{\frac{1}{{si{n^2}{\rm{\theta }}}}}}{{\frac{1}{{co{s^2}{\rm{\theta }}}}}} - \left( {\frac{1}{{co{s^2}{\rm{\theta }}}}\; + \;\frac{1}{{si{n^2}{\rm{\theta }}}}} \right)\)
⇒ sin2θ/cos2θ + cos2θ/sin2θ – (sin2θ + cos2θ)/sin2θ cos2θ
⇒ tan2 θ + cot2 θ – 1/(sin2 θ cos2θ)
⇒ tan2 θ + cot2 θ – cosec2 θ sec2θ
⇒ tan2 θ + cosec2 θ – 1 – sec2 θ cosec2 θ
⇒ tan2 θ – 1 + cosec2 θ (1 – sec2 θ)
⇒ tan2 θ – cosec2 θ tan2 θ – 1
⇒ tan2 θ (1 – cosec2 θ) – 1
⇒ tan2 θ (- cot2 θ) – 1
⇒ (- 1) – 1
⇒ (- 2)

Question: If (5x + 2y) : (10x + 3y) = 5 : 9, then (2x<sup>2</sup> + 3y<sup>2</sup>) : (4x<sup>2</sup> + 9y<sup>2</sup>) = ?
The value of \(\frac{{2\sqrt {10} }}{{\sqrt 5 \; + \;\sqrt 2 - \sqrt 7 }} - \sqrt {\frac{{\sqrt 5 - 2}}{{\sqrt 5 \; + \;2}}} - \frac{3}{{\sqrt 7 - 2}}\;\) is:
Solution:
Calculation:
\(\frac{{2\sqrt {10} }}{{\sqrt 5 \; + \;\sqrt 2 - \sqrt 7 }} - \sqrt {\frac{{\sqrt 5 - 2}}{{\sqrt 5 \; + \;2}}} - \frac{3}{{\sqrt 7 - 2}}\)
\(\Rightarrow {\rm{\;}}\frac{{2\sqrt {10} }}{{\sqrt 5 \; + \;\sqrt 2 - \sqrt 7 }}{\rm{\;}} \times {\rm{\;}}\frac{{\left( {\sqrt 5 \; + \;\sqrt 2 } \right)\; + \;\sqrt 7 }}{{\left( {\sqrt 5 \; + \;\sqrt 2 } \right)\; + \;\sqrt 7 }} - \sqrt {\frac{{\sqrt 5 - 2}}{{\sqrt 5 \; + \;2}}{\rm{\;}} \times {\rm{\;}}\frac{{\sqrt 5 - 2}}{{\sqrt 5 - 2}}} - \frac{3}{{\sqrt 7 - 2}}{\rm{\;}} \times {\rm{\;}}\frac{{\sqrt 7 {\rm{\;}} + {\rm{\;}}2}}{{\sqrt 7 {\rm{\;}} + {\rm{\;}}2}}\)
\(\Rightarrow {\rm{\;}}\frac{{2\sqrt {10} \left( {\sqrt 5 \; + \;\sqrt 2 \; + \;\sqrt 7 } \right)}}{{{{\left( {\sqrt 5 \; + \;\sqrt 2 } \right)}^2} - {{\left( {\sqrt 7 } \right)}^2}}} - \sqrt {\frac{{{{\left( {\sqrt 5 - 2} \right)}^2}}}{{{{\left( {\sqrt 5 } \right)}^2} - {2^2}}}} - \frac{{3{\rm{\;}}\left( {\sqrt 7 {\rm{\;}} + {\rm{\;}}2} \right)}}{{{{\left( {\sqrt 7 } \right)}^2} - {2^2}}}\)
\(\Rightarrow {\rm{\;}}\frac{{2\sqrt {10} \left( {\sqrt 5 \; + \;\sqrt 2 \; + \;\sqrt 7 } \right)}}{{5\; + \;2\; + \;2\sqrt {10} - 7}} - \frac{{\left( {\sqrt 5 - 2} \right)}}{{5 - 4}} - \frac{{3{\rm{\;}}\left( {\sqrt 7 {\rm{\;}} + {\rm{\;}}2} \right)}}{{7 - 4}}\)
\(\Rightarrow {\rm{\;}}\frac{{2\sqrt {10} \left( {\sqrt 5 \; + \;\sqrt 2 \; + \;\sqrt 7 } \right)}}{{2\sqrt {10} }} - \left( {\sqrt 5 - 2} \right) - \frac{{3{\rm{\;}}\left( {\sqrt 7 {\rm{\;}} + {\rm{\;}}2} \right)}}{3}\)
⇒ √5 + √2 + √7 - √5 + 2 - √7 – 2
∴ The required value is √2.

Question:
The given graph shows the weights of students in a school on a particular day.


Question:
The number of students weighing less 50 kg is what per cent less than the number of students weighing 55 kg or more?
Solution:
Number of students weighing less 50 kg = 40 + 30 = 70
Number of students weighing 55 kg or more = 55 + 45 + 25 = 125
Required percentage = [(125 – 70)/125] × 100 = 44%
